160.title: The Arrival of a Train at La Ciotat
160.plot: Likely in June 1897, a group of people are standing along the platform of a railway station in La Ciotat, waiting for a train. One is seen coming, at some distance, and eventually stops at the platform. Doors of the railway-cars open and attendants help passengers off and on.  Popular legend has it that, when this film was shown, the first-night audience fled the café in terror, fearing being run over by the "approaching" train. This legend has since been identified as promotional embellishment, though there is evidence to suggest that people were astounded at the capabilities of the Lumières' cinématographe.

178985.title: Leaving Jerusalem by Railway
178985.plot: Lasting for roughly 50 seconds, it shows the goodbyes of many passersby - first Europeans, then Palestinian Arabs, then Palestinian Jews - as a train leaves Jerusalem.

179234.title: The Miller and the Sweep
179234.plot: In front of a flour mill, two men fight. One is the miller, and he's swinging a bag of flour in the scuffle. The other is a chimney sweep, and he's swinging what may be a bag of flour, but when it breaks open, it's clearly something else. Well into the havoc, spectators gather and give chase to the flour-covered sweep and the "well-sooted" miller.

183299.title: Head of Colonial Procession, Canadians, etc

183303.title: Caped Mounted Riflemen Passing St Paul's

183306.title: Royal Carriage Arriving at St Paul's

183308.title: Royal Princes in St. Paul's Churchyard

183309.title: Queen's Carriage and Indian Escort Arriving at St. Paul's

183310.title: Life Guards and Princes North of St Paul's

183311.title: Women Fetching Water from the Nile

183312.title: Fishermen and Boat at Port Said

183313.title: Cupid at the Washtub
183313.plot: A playful variation on A Soldier's Courtship, producer Robert W. Paul's smash hit from the previous year, this film spies on a young man trying to tease a kiss from a young girl doing the washing at a tub. For his efforts, the man receives a dunking in the tub himself and much hilarity follows. (IMDb)

183315.title: Robbery
183315.plot: A robber forces a luckless stroller in the park to remove his hat, coat, waistcoat and trousers.

185447.title: Dewars Scotch Whisky
185447.plot: In slow motion, a line of giddy, possibly drunk men dressed in Scottish highland outfits perform a disorderly dance routine in front of a sign advertising the product of the title. This film is often incorrectly described as the first filmed advertisement.

189576.title: Bonne d'enfants et soldat
189576.plot: A maid is out walking with her young charge when a soldier takes the boy's place.

189582.title: Bocal aux poissons-rouges
189582.plot: […] by shooting the fish in a globular bowl, the Lumières effectively use a fisheye lens, which offers distortions. The history of cinema has witnessed a struggle between the objective and subjective camera and the optically distorting lenses like the fisheye lens has been a powerful tool for the subjective camera. Here it is at the start. (from IMDB)

189813.title: The First Sleigh-Ride
189813.plot: “This subject taken just after the recent first fall of snow, shows two enthusiastic horsemen indulging in a "brush" with their respective horses and cutters.” (Maguire & Baucus)

189820.title: Fifth Avenue, New York
189820.plot: "The famous parade ground of Metropolitan fashion. Exquisitely gowned women, club men, actresses, millionaires pass by on their afternoon stroll." - from the Edison Catalog

189821.title: Return of Lifeboat
189821.plot: Along the seashore near San Francisco, a boat belonging to the Pacific Coast Life Saving Service can just be seen as it returns to shore. Several men are at the oars. As the boat approaches land, it must make its way through rough waves and surging water.

190571.title: Bains en mer
190571.plot: Swimmers jump into the water from the docks, as a small boat passes by.

190587.title: Lyon, travaux au canal de Jonage: Machine à damer
190587.plot: A group of workers, aided by a steam-roller, are leveling the ground during the construction of the Jonage canal, a diversion of the Rhône river, which was built in order to supply the hydroelectric plant of Cusset.

191598.title: Washerwomen on the River
191598.plot: Women wash clothes in a washhouse on the edge of a river.

191641.title: Coolies à Saïgon
191641.plot: Two lines of workers, pulling a steamroller, somewhere in the streets of Saigon, Vietnam (nowadays, Ho Chi Minh City).

192794.title: Faust : apparition de Méphistophélès
192794.plot: A short reenactment of a scene from Goethe's Faust.

192796.title: Le cigare introuvable
192796.plot: Three portly, white-face clowns wrangle over a cigar stub. One of them keeps it by hiding it in his mouth and similar ruses.

193617.title: Danse des Ciociari
193617.plot: Lumiere brothers actuality, filmed the 12th of March 1896 in Rome, in front of the Spanish Steps. It shows some couples of Ciociari performing their traditional dance. The Ciociari are the  inhabitants of Ciociaria, a region in the south east of Rome.

193627.title: Garde descendante du Palais Saint James

193629.title: Lourdes, transporting the sick, II
193629.plot: Patients on stretchers are lifted off a cart and carried toward the shrine at Lourdes.

193633.title: Carnaval, [I]
193633.plot: Several shots of the carnival in Nice, floats and parade costumes, passing along the crowded streets.

193634.title: Carnaval, [II]
193634.plot: Several shots of the carnival in Nice, floats and parade costumes, passing along the crowded streets.

193635.title: Carnaval, [III]
193635.plot: Several shots of the carnival in Nice, floats and parade costumes, passing along the crowded streets.

193636.title: Carnaval, [IV]
193636.plot: Several shots of the carnival in Nice, floats and parade costumes, passing along the crowded streets.

193637.title: Carnaval, [V]
193637.plot: Several shots of the carnival in Nice, floats and parade costumes, passing along the crowded streets.

193639.title: Carnaval, [VI]
193639.plot: Several shots of the carnival in Nice, floats and parade costumes, passing along the crowded streets.

193640.title: Carnaval, [VII]
193640.plot: Several shots of the carnival in Nice, floats and parade costumes, passing along the crowded streets.

193642.title: Carnaval, [VIII]
193642.plot: Several shots of the carnival in Nice, floats and parade costumes, passing along the crowded streets.

193801.title: Paris, cortège du bœuf gras (char du prince du carnaval)

194570.title: Mauvaises herbes
194570.plot: In a field, three women are using pitchforks in order to feed a small fire with weeds.

194581.title: Défilé de la garde nationale du district de Columbia
194581.plot: Officers and soldiers, followed by a military band, parade in front of decorated grandstands.

194600.title: Japanese Sword Fencing
194600.plot: The earliest surviving Japanese film showing the martial art of kendo.

194601.title: On the Roofs
194601.plot: Two crooks throw a lady off a roof, and a hapless policeman tries to capture them.

194603.title: Naval Combat in Greece
194603.plot: An officer calls his sailors to the deck. They assemble around the canon while the officer scans the horizon. They all turn in the direction of the camera to look in the distance. At the same time the ship is hit! This scene is a filmed reconstruction of the 1897 Greek-Turkish war.

194604.title: The Last Cartridges
194604.plot: An incident of the Franco-Prussian War. It shows the bombardment of a house at Bazeille. It is the animated reproduction of de Neuville's celebrated painting.

194606.title: Colleurs d'affiches
194606.plot: A bill poster comes upon a blank wall, and immediately puts up a poster advertising a movie show at one location.

194607.title: Crissie Sheridan
194607.plot: A woman in a white gown performs a skirt dance, using her arms to produce circles and other patterns within the folds of her costume. Her legs and feet appear to be bare. (Library of Congress)

194609.title: Ballet Libella
194609.plot: A woman wearing dragonfly wings performs a romantic dreamlike dance.

194612.title: The Pyramids (Overview)
194612.plot: A view of the Great Sphinx with two of Giza's pyramids in the background. A caravan passes the scene.

194614.title: The Lover in the Bag
194614.plot: A balcony courting scene turns into a man being beaten in a sack.

194615.title: Jérusalem : porte de Jaffa, côté Est
194615.plot: Small glimpse of city life in Jerusalem.

194617.title: Constantinople, panorama de la corne d'or

194618.title: Nègres Ashantis: Danse du sabre II

195072.title: Police Patrol Wagon
195072.plot: "It dashes up just in time to gather in the crowd of rowdies that are fighting. The policemen hustle the toughs off to the station house."

195073.title: Transport of a Turret by a Team of 60 Horses
195073.plot: A very heavy turret is transported on a truck drawn by a long line of horses.  The inscription “Charlemagne 53790K” readable on the turret suggests that this view was shot in the vicinity of Saint-Chamond, a town where there are factories specializing in the construction of heavy steel. It is certainly a turret intended for the battleship “Charlemagne”. In addition, a view projected by the Aléthorama on January 20, 1898 in Saint-Étienne, and entitled “Transportation of the armored turret of Saint-Chamond by a team of 80 horses”, could represent the same event.

195074.title: Paris, le Pont-Neuf
195074.plot: Small glimpse of Paris city life.

195078.title: S.S. 'Queen' Leaving Dock
195078.plot: A crowded ship heading out to sea.

195079.title: Fisherman's Wharf
195079.plot: Shows the wharf at San Francisco, Cal., with a large fleet of fishing boats at anchor.

195081.title: Horses loading for Klondike, no. 9
195081.plot: The wharf is crowded with live stock, and the huge derrick slowly drops the large box or sling into the bunch. Into this cradle a horse is led, and is slowly hoisted and swung over to the deck of the steamer. This picture is taken ten minutes before sailing time.

195084.title: Loading baggage for Klondike, no. 6
195084.plot: This was the first ship sailing for the Klondike from Seattle during the gold rush of 1897. The picture shows the excitement and enthusiasm that attended the great Klondike exodus. Crowds of anxious gold seekers watch the loading of their outfits, clothing, kits and provisions into the hole of the Williamette.

195085.title: First Avenue, Seattle, Washington, No. 8
195085.plot: From Edison films catalog: Taken during the Klondike excitement. The streets are crowded with miners buying outfits and supplies. Mule trains, trolley cars and hurrying pedestrians give life and bustle to the scene. 50 feet. $7.50.  Advertised as part of the "Northern Pacific Railway Series" (Edison films catalog): The following pictures were taken by our artists at various points on the Northern Pacific Railway. We are greatly indebted to their officials who afforded us every opportunity in their power to obtain these splendid views. Many of the scenes are incident to the excitement prevailing at the time of the Klondike gold rush. They show the resources of this company for handling large numbers of people, baggage, freight and excursion parties, and give to prospective tourists and merchants an idea of the facilities with which this road handles traffic of all kinds (p. 9). (LoC)

195086.title: Stanford University, California
195086.plot: People walking around the campus. The view shows an immense arch in the background through which are seen coming groups of students, some walking, others on bicycles. The ivy covered walls of the building form the background to a pleasing picture.

195087.title: Fishing smacks
195087.plot: Another Edison film shot in San Francisco at the Fisherman's Wharf. Once again the camera is looking down on a group of men doing their jobs.

195088.title: Launch of life boat
195088.plot: This Edison short delivers everything the title says. In 24-seconds we see a boat being lowered into the water led by Capt. Joseph Hodgson. The boat is put into the water and it quickly disappears out of frame on a drill helping them prepare for a real sinking.

195090.title: Buffalo Stockyards
195090.plot: From Edison films catalog: A long line of horses, mules and ponies are led, driven and ridden into the yards, where they are sold and distributed.

195091.title: Buffalo Fire Department in action
195091.plot: Ten horse-drawn pieces of equipment of the Buffalo Fire Department pass by a stationary camera that looks down a broad avenue as they come toward it...

195092.title: Entrée d'une noce à l'église
195092.plot: A marriage procession following the bride and her father enter a church.

195093.title: S.S. 'Williamette' Leaving for Klondike
195093.plot: Another Edison film of a ship departing.

195095.title: S.S. 'Coptic' Sailing Away
195095.plot: “Shows the vessel after she has been fully turned and on her way across the Pacific. The boat shows large and clear with smoke coming from the stack. In the foreground is a constantly changing crowd of people composed of men, women and children. Action is added by some late comers who rush to the dock to wave their last farewell. Life-size, sharp and clear.” (F.Z. Maguire catalogue)

195096.title: S.S. 'Coptic' at Dock
195096.plot: Taken at the docks of the Pacific Steamship Co., San Francisco, Cal., which is operated in connection with the Southern Pacific Railroad Co...

195100.title: Racing at Sheepshead Bay
195100.plot: The finish and weighing out of a running race with nine starters. Won by the famous Clifford, Sloane up.

195101.title: Southern Pacific Overland Mail
195101.plot: Taken on the S.P. Railroad, near tunnel No. 9. The train comes rushing out of the tunnel and passes at full speed...

195102.title: Free-for-All race at Charter Oak Park
195102.plot: Great horse racing on the famous Hartford track, showing start and finish of a 2.04 3/4 heat run by the fastest harness horse in the world, John R. Gentry.

195105.title: Lick Observatory, Mt. Hamilton, Cal.
195105.plot: From F.Z. Maguire catalogue: The background of this picture is the Lick Observatory, Mount Hamilton, Cal. This observatory, the gift of James Lick, of Pennsylvania, was constructed at a cost of $700,000, being equipped with one of the most powerful telescopes that has ever been produced, and is famous the world over. The view of the Observatory is very complete, showing the style of architecture, including the glass covered dome in which are placed the various astronomical instruments. Every Saturday night throughout the year is set apart for visitors to inspect the Observatory and look through the great glass. This view shows a coach load driving up and alighting.

195108.title: Cairo, Artillery Parade
195108.plot: An artillery parade in Cairo near Cairo Citadel filmed by Alexandre Promio for the Lumière Brothers. Original title was "Défilé de l’artillerie turque"

195109.title: Hotel Del Monte
195109.plot: Shows a party of tourists at this famous resort; located in Monterey, Cal., on the Southern Pacific Railroad. The magnificence of its surroundings is clearly shown.  This early sponsored film by Southern Pacific Railroad offers views of tourists at the opulent resort in Monterey, California.

195110.title: Hotel Vendome, San Jose, Cal.
195110.plot: This Edison short takes us to San Jose, CA where we visit the Hotel Vendome (just as the title suggests).

195113.title: Lurline Baths
195113.plot: "The main feature is the toboggan slide. Some sit down while others lie down, either head or feet first."

195114.title: Douche après le bain
195114.plot: Four young people throwing buckets of water at each other.

195115.title: Buffalo Police on Parade
195115.plot: A street scene showing parade of the entire Buffalo Police Department, 16 men abreast, with military band.

195116.title: Surf at Monterey
195116.plot: From Edison films catalog: The water breaks over the rocks, and is dashed into silvery spray, high into the air. Exceptionally fine water effects.

195117.title: Fast mail, Northern Pacific Railroad
195117.plot: Here is a twelve car train dashing along at a high rate of speed. It is seen first in the distance and approaches and then passes by the camera...

195120.title: Corner Madison and State Streets, Chicago
195120.plot: The busiest corner in Chicago. Cable cars and street traffic of all descriptions. Hundreds of shoppers. Fine perspective view looking north toward the Masonic Temple.

195121.title: Dance, Franchonetti Sisters
195121.plot: Three young women with dark, curly hair stand on a stage with a black background and patterned carpet or tile underfoot. They wear tights, ballet shoes, and frilly dresses to the knee with multiple petticoats and ruffled drawers. They begin by raising their right legs up by their heads, and then perform a dance with a variety of kicks and leg movements, their hands either in the air or pulling up their skirts. The sisters also grab their right legs again and hop in a circle, then do cartwheels and land on the floor in the splits. Jumping back to their feet, the women twirl in circles and around each other in circles in what appears to be a type of pirouette, while holding up their skirts and showing their bloomers in a manner similar to the cancan.

195122.title: Sutro Baths, No. 2
195122.plot: “Another view in which the figures show larger. A springboard furnishes the bathers with much amusement; also a toboggan slide.” (Edison film catalog)

195123.title: Sutro Baths, No. 1
195123.plot: One of the sights of San Francisco. A 50-foot slide is used by the bathers, who toboggan down its slippery surface in all positions...

195124.title: Cupid and Psyche
195124.plot: “By the Leanders. The dress of one consists of a pair of wings and a bow and arrow; the other represents a fairy. Bathers in all stages of dress and undress watch the graceful dance.” (Edison film catalog)

195125.title: Philadelphia Express, Jersey Central Railway
195125.plot: Stationary camera on a railroad yard.

195129.title: Water Fall in the Catskills
195129.plot: "Beautiful water effects at Haines' Falls, a most picturesque and charming mountain cataract. The wild and rugged surroundings are very impressive.

195130.title: Capsize of Lifeboat
195130.plot: Daily practice of life boat crew, showing boat being upset purposely by the men. As these boats are self-righting and self-bailing, the scene is particularly interesting.

195131.title: Cattle Driven to Slaughter
195131.plot: In the Chicago stockyards, the gates of a pen of long-horn cattle are open and the cattle are being herded out by several cowhands.

195132.title: Armour's Electric Trolley
195132.plot: At the Armour & Co. Chicago yard. Two railroad tracks dominate the center and right half of the frame as we look down about 40 meters where an overpass crosses...

195133.title: Attelage d'un camion
195133.plot: A parade of horses pulling a very large and, one must assume, heavy cart.

195134.title: Falls of Minnehaha
195134.plot: The 'Laughing Waters' of Longfellow's 'Hiawatha.' A beautiful view of this picturesque and celebrated waterfall.

195137.title: Fisherman's Luck
195137.plot: "Two German anglers are fishing, with odd results. One gets a bite, and pulls in a length of stovepipe. The other is so astonished that he falls overboard."

195139.title: Driving with Greenland Dogs
195139.plot: Johan Carl Joensen, a Danish colonial manager in Greenland, drives his dog sled in Copenhagen’s Fælledparken. (stumfilm.dk)

195142.title: Sheep Run, Chicago Stockyards
195142.plot: "Shows a large flock of sheep being driven from the cars to the slaughter house."

195143.title: Leander Sisters
195143.plot: “A clever characteristic dance called the 'Yellow Kid.' Very unique. Stage is in the Sutro Baths, San Francisco, Cal., and the audience is composed largely of bathers.” (Edison Catalog)

195144.title: Death of Marat
195144.plot: This early film made by Georges Hatot for the Lumière Company is a brief single shot-scene of the assassination of the French revolutionary writer, Jean-Paul Marat--who has the notorious distinction of having influenced the Reign of Terror.

195147.title: Football
195147.plot: Short clip of a football match, filmed on the Lumière cinematograph, 33 years before FIFA's 1st World Cup.

195148.title: Brandvæsenet rykker ud
195148.plot: At first this looks like another of those innumerable fire brigade movies of the era in which you saw the horses charging pellmell out of the firehouse, pulling the firemen and the equipment. Usually they would be on wheels, occasionally on sleigh runner, but always the same: fire departments from Buffalo, New York, Chicago and probably Omsk and Tomsk. This one is different: you see not only the fire brigade heading out for the fire, you see the site of the fire itself.

195149.title: Place du Pont
195149.plot: A shot of a street in Lyon, people passing, horses etc

195186.title: Comic Face
195186.plot: An old man gets progressively livelier - and drunker - as he downs his bottle of beer. Finally, he cocks a snook - and doesn't bother to uncock it as he continues to drink.

196244.title: Nègres Ashantis: Toilette d'un negrillon II
196244.plot: A woman from the Ashanti tribe bathes her child in a shallow bowl.

196245.title: Barrage du Nil
196245.plot: Travellers, nomads and salesmen make their way along a dam next to the Nile.

196250.title: Charmeur d'oiseaux
196250.plot: An elderly man wearing a silk top hat, mesmerises sparrows –and his audience- in a public square.

196583.title: Paris, mi-carême : char de la reine des reines

196666.title: Belfast, Castle Place
196666.plot: A street scene in Belfast showing several horse-drawn omnibuses.

198314.title: 99ème régiment d'infanterie : assaut du portique
198314.plot: A regiment of soldiers demonstrate their skills.

201406.title: Exit of the Twelve O'clock Mass of the Pillar of Saragossa
201406.plot: Short recording of several parishioners leaving the city's basilica. It is considered the first Spanish film in history.

212342.title: Railway Ride over the Tay Bridge
212342.plot: Phantom ride shot from the engine front as a steam train pulling away from Wormit station in Fife, crossing the Tay rail bridge and passing south bound trains.

212359.title: Panorama des rives du Nil, [I]
212359.plot: Panoramic view of the banks of the River Nile.

212362.title: Serpentine Dance: Loïe Fuller
212362.plot: Loïe Fuller performs a serpentine dance.

212364.title: Dancing Darkey Boy
212364.plot: A young boy dances on a table top.

230955.title: École de cavalerie de Saumur, le carrousel militaire: Changement de main
230955.plot: A military horseback riding event from 1897.

230961.title: Nice, panorama du casino pris d'un bateau
230961.plot: Panorama of Nice from the deck of a ship.

230967.title: Danse d'hommes
230967.plot: African men dance, sing and play instruments.

231044.title: Stockholm, entrée de l'exposition
231044.plot: A view of the entrance to the Stockholmsutställlningen, the World Exhibition in Stockholm.

231049.title: Buffalo Bill: peaux rouges
231049.plot: One minute film of Buffalo Bill's famous show.

231057.title: The Assassination of the Duke de Guise
231057.plot: This one is modelled on the painting by Paul Delaroche and is an extension of the stage act known as “tableau vivant”.

231066.title: Berne : arrivée du roi de Siam
231066.plot: The arrival of King Rama V, the king of Siam, in Switzerland.

231067.title: Cheval de haute école, II
231067.plot: A man trots around on a horse for the camera.

231072.title: Boxers in Barrels
231072.plot: Two boxers climb into barrels and proceed to pummel each other in this novelty film from the Lumières.

231083.title: Liverpool, la rade
231083.plot: Liverpool, the sparse. Boats in Liverpool.

231108.title: Washington, le président McKinley adressant son message au peuple
231108.plot: A crowd of spectators listen to President William McKinley's speech during his inauguration ceremony outside the U.S. Capitol in Washington, D.C.

231116.title: Bruxelles, Grand’Place
231116.plot: The main market square in the heart of Brussels.

231123.title: Carrare, train sortant d'un tunnel
231123.plot: Carrara, Italy. A train loaded with marble exits a tunnel.

231126.title: Ballet, 'Le carnaval de Venise' II
231126.plot: A group of women dressed up as Commedia dell'Arte characters dance together.

231135.title: Prestidigitateur, I
231135.plot: A magician performs a few tricks.

231142.title: Le marchand de marrons
231142.plot: A man does a practical joke on a chestnut vendor.

231144.title: Roi et reine de Roumanie et leur escorte
231144.plot: Queen Elisabeth of Wied, in a carriage escorted by cavalry, followed by King Carol I and Prince Ferdinand of Hohenzollern on horseback, greeted by the crowd.

231147.title: Belfast : Queen's Bridge
231147.plot: Another critically acclaimed Lumiere street scene.

231149.title: Cuirassiers traversant la Saône à la nage

231155.title: Bethléem, une place
231155.plot: This street scene from Bethlehem shows a crowd of locals jumping on something in the middle of camera range. What are they seeking? The implication seems to be that they are beggars jumping on a handful of alms tossed onto the spot and the effect is simultaneously funny and sad.

231158.title: Rome, la gare
231158.plot: A Roman street scene from the Lumière Brothers.

231336.title: La paralytique
231336.plot: A young boy plays with a paralyzed old lady.

231346.title: Une rue à Tokyo
231346.plot: Rickshaws and pedestrians traffic on the street.

231354.title: Constantinople, panorama des rives du Bosphore
231354.plot: Panorama of Constantinople from the river.

231356.title: La défense du drapeau
231356.plot: As the only survivor of a battle, a cavalryman heroically defends his flag.

231417.title: Assassinat de Kleber
231417.plot: Staged assassination from the Lumiere company.

231424.title: Fête du jubilé de la reine d'Angleterre : le cortège, la reine
231424.plot: Another parade film from the Lumiere company.

231426.title: Feu de bois
231426.plot: Men burning a pile of wood.

231427.title: Victor Hugo et les principaux personnages des 'Misérables'
231427.plot: A man puts on several different faces.

231429.title: Le rémouleur et l'assiette au noir
231429.plot: Two men pull a practical prank on two victims.

231432.title: Une partie de lawn-tennis II
231432.plot: A group of friends playing tennis.

231443.title: Bruxelles, Boulevard Anspach
231443.plot: Another street scene of daily life.

231460.title: Mort de Robespierre
231460.plot: One minute costume drama from the Lumiere company.

231653.title: Butterfly Dance
231653.plot: "As performed by Annabelle, the famous premier danseuse. A charmingly graceful representation of the light and airy flight of a butterfly. Beautiful when colored."

231681.title: The Haunted Castle
231681.plot: George Albert Smith's remake of Georges Méliès - Le Manoir du diable (The Haunted Castle) from 1896.  This film is lost or never existed. Copies of it online are actually a Méliès film.

231687.title: The Vanishing Lady
231687.plot: Robert W. Paul production, "The Vanishing Lady", 1897. Man in roman costume carves figure of girl in doorway. As he finishes, the statue comes to life. The man expresses great love and desire for her, but every time the man goes to grab the girl she vanishes and reappears somewhere else.

231691.title: S.S. 'Queen' Loading
231691.plot: Shows the S.S. "Queen" at Seattle with an immense crowd of miners crowding the decks of the boat and the docks, carrying aboard baggage, implements, etc. Taken at the height of the excitement and gives a good idea of the vast numbers that started for the gold fields.

231699.title: Queen Victoria's Diamond Jubilee
231699.plot: A series of actuality films showing the procession to mark Queen Victoria's diamond jubilee.

231701.title: Cafe Brawl
231701.plot: Lost film in which two men discuss in a cafe for the love of a woman. Discussion becomes more heated until they start fist-fighting. Widely considered to be the first fiction film made in Spain, the director made a new version reconstructing it in 1952.

232636.title: Svanerne i Sortedamssøen
232636.plot: Swans getting handled as people watch.

237846.title: Pie Eating Contest
237846.plot: "Two men, with hands tied, are eating huckleberry pies for a wager, direct from the plates. Their faces and shirts are clean when they start. Extra ludicrous when colored."

282207.title: Chicken Thieves
282207.plot: The hen house occupies the entire left foreground of the picture, running back to the nearby road. The main foreground is filled with tall grass swept by the wind, the naturalness of which effect is remarkable. A thief appears 'round the corner, carrying a tattered sack. He suspiciously approaches the window, from which two fowl are handed to him by a black confederat, who himself suddenly appears at the window, falling out head first but clinging tenaciously to a fluttering white bird.

303637.title: The Arrival of the King of Siam in Stockholm
303637.plot: The first Swedish film by photographer Ernest Florman. Kung Oscar II welcomes King Chulalonkorn of Siam, now Thailand, at Logårdstrappan. King Chulalonkorn visited Sweden in connection with Stockholmsutställningen 1897.

32570.title: At the Top of Brooklyn Bridge

318798.title: Lourdes, procession, I
318798.plot: People carry candles in a procession in Lourdes.

318803.title: Voyage de M. le Président Félix Faure en Russie (Août 1897): Arrivée du président et du Czar à Peterhof
318803.plot: State officials meeting on a landing.

318808.title: Panorama pris en chemin de fer, départ de Dammurey
318808.plot: Shot from a train as it leaves a station.

318809.title: Acteurs japonais : bataille au sabre
318809.plot: Japanese actors act out an early martial arts weapons scene.

320674.title: Le prince et la princesse de Naples
320674.plot: Elena of Montenegro and Victor Emmanuel III, followed by their escort.

320682.title: Spain: Bullfighting
320682.plot: After a picador tries in vain to bite the bull, several cape passes are performed. Then, the bull gores several horses.

320774.title: Roi d'Italie et prince Victor passant la revue
320774.plot: King Umberto I and Prince Victor Emmanuel, followed by their escort, parade the troops standing at attention.

321523.title: Executive Mansion
321523.plot: Traffic of pedestrians, carts and trams on a Washington avenue.

321524.title: Défilé de l'artillerie du district de Columbia
321524.plot: Two teams of artillery carriages, parading side by side past the grandstand during the inauguration ceremony of President McKinley in Washington DC.

321526.title: Défilé du club républicain James Blaine
321526.plot: Uniformed men march in step, in widely spaced ranks of each other.

321754.title: Une partie de lawn-tennis, I
321754.plot: Tennis match between two women and a man.

321756.title: Petit frère et petite sœur
321756.plot: In a grove, a small boy and a small girl are dancing together.

321758.title: Ronde enfantine
321758.plot: A group of four children, circle dancing.

321770.title: Bath Scene
321770.plot: "This view was made at the Scheveningen Baths. It shows a number of bathers enjoying themselves in the surf. Several picturesque Holland boats are moored in the background."

322616.title: Arroseur et arrosé, III
322616.plot: A gardener is watering his flowers, when a mischievous boy sneaks up behind his back, and puts a foot on the water hose. The gardener is surprised and looks into the nozzle to find out why the water has stopped coming. The boy then lifts his foot from the hose, whereby the water squirts up in the gardener's face. The gardener chases the boy, grips his ear and slaps him in his buttocks. The boy then runs away and the gardener continues his watering. Three separate versions of this film exist, this is the third version.

323280.title: Bersagliers
323280.plot: A battalion of Bersaglieri charging, at the double, comes to a full stop; the first line goes down on bended knee, while others remain standing; and all fire their weapons repeatedly.

323288.title: Procession, I
323288.plot: Groups of men and women, parading in Interlaken, Switzerland, some of them carrying banners.

323290.title: Chutes du Rhin vues de près
323290.plot: The waterfalls in Neuhausen am Rheinfall, Switzerland, form a cloud of suspended droplets.

323301.title: Dîner japonais
323301.plot: A group of Japanese, eating dinner, somewhere in Kyoto, Honshu.

323308.title: Yokohama : déchargement dans un port
323308.plot: Porters carry baskets full of fish, while others carry bundles, on their shoulders, in Yokohama harbor.

323316.title: Les Aïnos à Yeso, [I]
323316.plot: Four Ainu men, performing a traditional dance, somewhere near Muroran, Hokkaido.

323318.title: Les Aïnos à Yeso, [II]
323318.plot: Ainu people, performing a traditional dance, somewhere near Muroran, Hokkaido. A group of women is spot-dancing, while a man circles around them.

329885.title: The Mischievous Monkey
329885.plot: "This is a very laughable scene. A guest in a hotel who has retired, is disturbed in his slumbers by a monkey, which enters through the window and goes through a series of queer antics. The part of the monkey is taken by a skilled acrobat; and his work in this scene is of a particularly clever sort." (AMB Picture Catalogue)

342727.title: The Hallucinated Alchemist
342727.plot: The Flicker Alley DVD "Georges Méliès: Encore New Discoveries (1896-1911)" misidentified a partial hand-colored print of the 1906 film "Alchimiste Parafaragaramus ou La cornue infernale" (The Mysterious Retort) as this film, "L'hallucination de l'alchimiste" (An Hallucinated Alchemist) from 1897, which continues to be considered a lost film.

343928.title: Fire Drill
343928.plot: The film had a skirmish to Firefighters from Havana pulling guard barracks pump, reel and carriage for help, two staircases and fire rising up to the roof, carrying hoses.

347012.title: Girls Swinging
347012.plot: In this 17-second short, a young woman is sitting on a swing and two other women alternate pushing her.

354740.title: Making Sausages
354740.plot: Butcher's crew make sausage from dogs and cats… and old boots…

366883.title: Place de la Concorde (Obelisk and Fountains)

366951.title: Liverpool, panorama pris du chemin de fer électrique, IV

366957.title: Locomobile
366957.plot: A steam roller equalizes the ground along a railroad track. The Canal de Jonage in France.

384742.title: Débarquement
384742.plot: Short film by Lumière of people disembarking from a boat at the port of nice.

415463.title: The Devil's Laboratory
415463.plot: "The picture shows the Devil working at a fire. Two cavaliers appear, and the Devil takes the form of a seer, old, bent and wrinkled. Then he disappears in a cloud of smoke, to reappear shortly as a ghost, whose head comes off and floats around the room. Suddenly the table gets up of itself, and flies up the chimney. All sorts of wonderful things happen. A cannon takes the place occupied by the table, and belches forth flame and smoke. A large cage appears mysteriously in the center of the room, through the bars of which the Devil passes as if it were an open door. By his magic, he makes the cavalier pass through the bars in the same wonderful fashion. Everything is so weird and fantastic, that such a small trifle as a man turning into a donkey excites but passing notice." -Edison catalog

415629.title: The Maid in the Garden
415629.plot: Master kisses maid behind a blanket on the clothes line and is seen by his wife.

415824.title: Weary Willie
415824.plot: Tramp hired to beat the carpet accidentally beats the housewife.

415825.title: Faust and Marguerite
415825.plot: Mephistopheles demands that Faust kill Marguerite.

426933.title: Prince Ranjitsinhji Practising Batting in the Nets

426935.title: President McKinley's Inauguration
426935.plot: This film was shot on March 4, 1897 and is historic because it was the first footage shot of a sitting American President.

429891.title: Serpentine Dance - Annabelle
429891.plot: 1897 version of Annabelle Moore performing a serpentine dance.

447647.title: Bruxelles, Sainte-Gudule
447647.plot: A shot of traffic, Sainte-Gudule in Bruxelles.

447648.title: Bruxelles, Place de Brouckère
447648.plot: A shot of traffic, Place de Brouckère in Bruxelles.

447653.title: Bruxelles, la bourse
447653.plot: A shot of traffic in front of Palais de la Bourse, Bruxelles.

453220.title: Projectile from Ten Inch Disappearing Gun Striking Water, Sandy Hook
453220.plot: "Result of a shot from the ten-inch disappearing gun."

453240.title: The Battery
453240.plot: "This picture, taken from a rapidly moving tug, gives a very comprehensive idea of the lower end of New York City, including prominent sky-scrapers, and the Aquarium. The photographic effects are quite stereoscopic."

453509.title: Atlantic City Fire Department
453509.plot: This picture is very notable from the fact that at the end of the scene, after the run-by of various engines and hose wagons, an engine was forced out of its course into the Biograph camera, smashing it to bits. The negative was saved out of the wreck and presents a remarkable photographic illusion, inasmuch as one who looks at it gets the effect at the end of the picture, of a fire engine at full tilt dashing directly toward him.

453763.title: Ambulance at the Accident
453763.plot: The victim is lying on a trolley car fender. Ambulance drives up and the injured man is removed in a stretcher.

453788.title: Fun on the Steeple-Chase
453788.plot: On the Coney Island steeple-chase, the wooden horses dash up and down the inclines with weird effect. The picture shows a crowd of people, including a number of pretty girls riding down the course.

453806.title: The Theatre Hat
453806.plot: Shows the discomfiture of those who are seated behind large hats at the theatre.

453808.title: Theatre Hats Off
453808.plot: A companion picture to No. 159 [THEATRE HAT]; showing how every one in an audience can get an uninterrupted view of the stage, when the ladies remove their hats.

453862.title: Mount and Dismount, Gatling Gun
453862.plot: This single camera position film shows an officer and six enlisted men of the army as they demonstrate the assembly drill of a gatling gun. See also: gatling gun-firing by squad, and gatling gun crew in action.

455191.title: Gigolos et gigolettes
455191.plot: A man is robbed of everything he's got and gets in trouble with the police about it.

460181.title: Boxing for Points
460181.plot: Men on field. Boxing. Both wear numbers on back. Large round-hose swings. Several men apparently refereeing. One with striped pants. Possible at west point. Mountain visible in background of large field.

470714.title: Pulmonary Hydatid Cyst Operation
470714.plot: Also known as The Operation of Dr. Alejandro Posadas. Filmed with early orthochromatic film in the Hospital de Clínicas de la Ciudad in Buenos Aires.

504917.title: Belfast, pompiers : Un Incendie, I
504917.plot: Also known as 'Un incendie à Dublin I', 'Crowds Watch City Fire Brigade' and 'Crowds Watch Dublin Fire Brigade.' Lumiere Catalog no. 710.

510875.title: Una cueca en Cavancha
510875.plot: Several young and cheerful children share at Cavancha Beach, while a couple begins to dance a cueca.

513906.title: Les Parisiennes
513906.plot: "A fascinating, up-to-date dancing diversion by four pretty girls in stunning costumes."

525185.title: Emperor Francis Joseph of Austria
525185.plot: Showing the Austrian Emperor laying the corner stone of a new military barracks.

525405.title: Lyon, travaux au canal de Jonage: locomobile
525405.plot: A few men working at the Jonage canel, Lyon.

525407.title: Liverpool, panorama pris du chemin de fer électrique, I
525407.plot: A moving image of the docks of Liverpool. Lumière Catalogue No. 704.

550931.title: The sea lions' home
550931.plot: The famous Seal Rocks at Golden Gate Park are here shown. Sea lions in their wild state are lying on the rocks and swimming and diving in the water.

568867.title: Has He Hit Me?
568867.plot: Two boxers miss their punches - until they don't.

577216.title: Liverpool, panorama pris du chemin de fer électrique, II
577216.plot: Lumière Catalogue No. 705. A view of the warehouses and docks taken from a local train in Liverpool, ending at the Princess Dock station.

577217.title: Liverpool, panorama pris du chemin de fer électrique, III
577217.plot: Lumière Catalogue No. 706. A moving shot taken from the electric train in Liverpool. Its vantage reveals ships and lumberyards.

581450.title: Sackville Street, Dublin
581450.plot: One reel containing actuality footage of Sackville Street (now O'Connell Street). Some of the earliest known film footage of Ireland.

598090.title: Afternoon Tea in the Gardens of Clarence House
598090.plot: Several members of European Royalty, including the Duke and Duchess of York, and Alfred, Duke of Edinburgh, seated round a tea-table in the grounds of Clarence House.

599676.title: An Irritable Model
599676.plot: An artist attempts to touch his model who is playing Venus. Later remade in 1900. While the film is lost, there is a new digital version based on re-creation from a flipbook produced by Léon Beaulieu around the same time.

599678.title: Boxing Match
599678.plot: A kickboxing movie. While the film is lost, there is a new digital version based on re-creation from a flipbook produced by Léon Beaulieu around the same time.

599680.title: Fencing at the Joinville School
599680.plot: A fencing match. While the film is lost, there is a new digital version based on re-creation from a flipbook produced by Léon Beaulieu around the same time.

601923.title: Queen Victoria's Diamond Jubilee Taken from Apsley
601923.plot: Film produced by John Le Couteur for Gaumont, using a 60mm Demeny camera, showing part of the procession to commemorate Queen Victoria's diamond jubilee.

607021.title: The Grasshopper and the Ant
607021.plot: A lost film directed by Georges Melies

607638.title: Single harness horses
607638.plot: Shows ten horses hitched to fashionable carts driven past the judges and grandstand to show their style, action and high-stepping movements. Among the drivers, Charles F. (Fatty ) Bates, the noted whip, shows up very prominently. The horses are all of very high class, and the action is of the very best. The film is clear, sharp and catchy.

625554.title: Launch of Surf Boat
625554.plot: The crew of seven dressed in cork jackets, push the boat through the surf; they clamber in and row out to the wreck. 50 ft.

634606.title: Ocean Greyhounds
634606.plot: 'The 'Nordland,' and 'Teutonic,' two well-known transatlantic steamers proceeding out of New York Harbor at full speed, bound for their trip across the Atlantic ocean. The dash of the water about their bows is shown very effectively.

641861.title: Kaiser Wilhelm II. beim Besuche der Vulkan-Werft in Stettin am 4. Mai 1897
641861.plot: This film shot by Oskar Messter shows a visit by Wilhelm II the AG Vulcan in Szczecin, one of the then leading shipyards in Germany. On display are the Emperor and some military and civil dignitaries, who walk on the landing stage of the factory site on the occasion of the launch of the transatlantic speed steamer "Kaiser Wilhelm the Great" a group of spectators. In his memoirs Messter has described the motion picture as "the first good close-up of the Emperor."

665050.title: Ten Inch Disappearing Carriage Gun Loading and Firing, Sandy Hook
665050.plot: "This is one of the most remarkable views that has ever been taken, and shows a modern high-power gun in act of discharge. The immense gun, weighing 67,000 pounds, is seen to rise in the air, discharge its projectile, and sink back behind the fortification ready for reloading. Showing the loading, raising, firing and recoil of the big ten-inch coast defense gun at the Government proving grounds, Sandy Hook. A remarkably fine picture."  —AMB Picture Catalogue

665855.title: Arrivée et déchargement d’un train de gravier
665855.plot: As a train comes to a halt, workers begin to unload the gravel it is transporting.

665997.title: Cheval à arçons
665997.plot: Two gymnasts successively perform various exercises on a pommel horse.

666006.title: Sauts à la perche
666006.plot: After several athletes have tried unsuccessfully to pole vault, one last gymnast performs a perfect jump.

679812.title: Entrée du cortège royal à l'Exposition
679812.plot: The Swedish Royal family arrives at the General Art and Industrial Exposition at Djurgården in Stockholm on 15 May 1897.

679815.title: Fête du jubilé de la reine d'Angleterre : la reine arrivant à Windsor

679835.title: Panorama des quais de la Saône à Lyon pris d'un bateau

696676.title: A Bowery Cafe
696676.plot: This is a Bowery barroom. A tough girl comes in for a pail of beer. While the bartender is serving her, a loafer steals the free lunch and puts it in his hat. The girl goes out and the loafer orders a drink; but not having the money to pay for it, he gets instead the contents of a siphon bottle squirted in his face.

696679.title: Boat Wagon and Beach Cart
696679.plot: Two carts, one with a boat on it, are being pushed out of a garage.

696689.title: Comic Shaving
696689.plot: A man comes in for a shave in this film of a popular stage act.

696693.title: Crawford Shoe Store
696693.plot: Crawford's had a store in Madison Square, New York. The horse-drawn buses were typical and can be seen in photographs of Madison Square at this date.

696696.title: Husking Bee
696696.plot: Shows a party of young people in front of a barn door, searching for the red ear, which is discovered, and the penalty exacted from one of the group who resists payment of the forfeit, thereby creating confusion and merriment. The group is animated, and is made up of real farmer boys and girls. During the progress of husking, the farmer arrives wheeling his little daughter to the sport on a barrow.

710937.title: Jumbo, Horseless Fire-Engine
710937.plot: The great automobile fire engine on its way to a conflagration, accompanied by hose wagons, etc. A very exciting scene.

713306.title: Place de la Concorde (vue prise du côté ouest)

715807.title: The Haverstraw Tunnel
715807.plot: A train travels along the tracks of the West Shore railroad in Rockland county. It goes through the Haverstraw Tunnel and out the other side.

717261.title: Ancoradouro de Pescadores na Baía de Guanabara
717261.plot: First Brazillian film, actuality film showing the Guanabara bay and a fisherman's port. Actually considered to be lost, reaming only 24 frames of the film

717262.title: Bailado de Crianças no Colégio do Andaraí

717965.title: Panorama des rives de la Seine, I

717968.title: Panorama des rives de la Seine, II

719504.title: La bandera argentina
719504.plot: The Argentinian flag waving at the Plaza de Mayo in Buenos Aires. Currently a lost film.

722395.title: Place de la Concorde et entrée de la rue Royale

723040.title: Bataille de femmes interrompue par un chien

726370.title: Une bataille dans le vieux Stockholm
726370.plot: A fight breaks out between two men in medieval Stockholm, Sweden.

750088.title: Home Life of a Hungarian Family
750088.plot: Nothing more novel than this picture could be shown to an American audience. The view was taken in the doorway of a peasant's hovel. The family, in gala attire, from the grandfather down to the baby, are entertaining some visiting friends. Wine is brought forth, visitors treated, and their health drunk by the happy family.

751037.title: Place de la Concorde
751037.plot: A beautiful view of one of the most celebrated spots in the French capital. A magnificent fountain is playing in the background of the picture, and elegant equipages drive by.

751662.title: Hiram Maxim and His Quick-firing Gun
751662.plot: Hiram Maxim shows off his machine gun.

751664.title: Firing the Maxim Gun
751664.plot: Hiram Maxim shows off his cannon

751670.title: Passage des portiques (École de gymnastique de Joinville)

751674.title: A Camp of Zingaree Gypsies
751674.plot: Roma families eat, drink, dance, and play

772975.title: Queen Victoria's Diamond Jubilee
772975.plot: Compilation film showing various parts of the procession to commemorate Queen Victoria's diamond jubilee.

772983.title: Queen Victoria's Carriage
772983.plot: Brief actuality footage showing Queen Victoria's open landau, bearing the Princess of Wales and Princess Christian. The location and filmmaker remain unidentified.

772984.title: Queen Victoria's Garden Party at Buckingham Palace
772984.plot: Queen Victoria at a Buckingham Palace garden party held in June 1897, following the diamond jubilee celebrations.

780842.title: Fregoli in palcoscenico ovvero Fregoli barbiere maldestro
780842.plot: Barber shop skit with Leopoldo Fregoli.

780844.title: Fregoli retroscena ovvero Fregoli donna
780844.plot: A man enters and pays homage to the lady standing before him. He turns away, and the lad takes off her clothes and reveals herself as a young man: Fregoli.

782664.title: The Dolorita Passion Dance
782664.plot: "Musicians are seated, playing, while the graceful Dolorita dances. It is the Danse-du-Ventre, the famous Oriental muscle dance."

786509.title: Dublin, Départ de la gare. Panorama

786510.title: Panorama du départ de la gare d’Ambérieu pris du train (temps de neige)

786544.title: Jérusalem : la Voie douloureuse et entrée du Saint-Sépulcre

787160.title: Entrée du château dans le vieux Stockholm

787333.title: Suburban Handicap, 1897
787333.plot: The Suburban is run at Sheepshead Bay track, Coney Island. Several views of the great race are given. The parade to the post, the start, the finish showing Ben Brush winning, Simms up, with the others strung out, tearing down the stretch in the dust, under whip and spur. Then the weighing out, jockeys saluting, dismounting, and un-saddling.

791527.title: D. Devant, Conjurer
791527.plot: A man pulls a rabbit out of a hat.  Available in a fragment in flipbook version only.

823042.title: Arrivée d'un bateau et débarquement à l'exposition

823054.title: Saltsjöbaden : départ en chemin de fer, panorama

823058.title: Arrivée de la garde au palais royal, I

823062.title: Arrivée de la garde au palais royal, II

824384.title: Gardes à pied : exercices à la baïonnette

826444.title: Interview Between Napoleon and the Pope
826444.plot: This reconstruction refers to a meeting that allegedly took place on 25 November 1804 at Fontainebleau between Pope Pius VII and Napoleon to discuss the coronation.

828211.title: Bédouins avec chameaux sortant de l’octroi

828213.title: Le Caire, Place de la Citadelle

828313.title: Le Caire, sortie du pont de Kasr-el-Nil (chameaux)

828314.title: Le Caire, sortie du pont de Kasr-el-Nil

829011.title: Jaffa : panorama en chemin de fer

829013.title: Jaffa : panorama en chemin de fer (collines)

829016.title: Jérusalem : Porte de Jaffa, côté ouest

829665.title: Fête du jubilé de la reine d'Angleterre : Le cortège, les princes étrangers

829672.title: Fête du jubilé de la reine d'Angleterre : la foule suivant le cortège

829692.title: Fête du jubilé de la reine d'Angleterre : le cortège, les ambassadeurs

829710.title: Fête du jubilé de la reine d'Angleterre : le cortège, les gardes du corps et la musique des dragons

829762.title: Fête du jubilé de la reine d'Angleterre : le cortège, l’artillerie de marine

829765.title: Fête du jubilé de la reine d'Angleterre : le cortège, les cavaliers du Cap

829776.title: Fête du jubilé de la reine d'Angleterre : le cortège, l’artillerie à cheval

829800.title: Gardes à pied : marche de front

829806.title: Panorama de la ville pris d’un bateau

830016.title: Arrivée de M. le président et du tsar à Peterhof

830019.title: Suite du cortège passant devant l’amiral Avellan

830026.title: Arrivée de M. le président à Saint-Pétersbourg

830032.title: M. le président passant devant la compagnie d’honneur

830093.title: Officiers russes attachés au président et journalistes

830095.title: Revue de Krasnoïe Selo : charge des hussards de l’impératrice

830100.title: Revue de Krasnoïe Selo : artillerie de forteresse

830108.title: Panorama de la ligne de Peterhof

830112.title: Les boxeurs et le spectateur trop curieux puni

830757.title: Faust : métamorphose de Faust et apparition de Marguerite

831242.title: Bateaux sur le lac de St-James Park

831245.title: Départ d’un bateau sur la Tamise

831247.title: Panorama du palais de Westminster pris de la Tamise

831338.title: Ligne de Belfast à Kingstown, I

831341.title: Ligne de Belfast à Kingstown, II

831354.title: Ligne de Belfast à Kingstown, III

831377.title: 13e hussards : arrivée et pied à terre

831379.title: 13e hussards : exercices du sabre, pied à terre et départ

832209.title: Le président arrivant à l’inauguration du monument de Paul Baudry

832294.title: Le président après l’inauguration du monument de Paul Baudry

832296.title: Débarquement de M. le président au Carnet

832299.title: M. le président arrivant au bal des Sablaises

832325.title: Arrivée de M. le président dans l’arsenal

832361.title: M. le président à l’hôpital militaire écoutant le compliment d’une petite fille

832369.title: Cortège de M. le président sortant de la gare

832459.title: Ré : débarquement de M. le président

832472.title: Arrivée de M. le président à Sainte-Marie

832475.title: Embarquement de M. le président au départ de l’Ile de Ré

832476.title: Arrivée en voiture à la gare

834426.title: Lourdes, procession, II
834426.plot: People carry candles in a procession in Lourdes.

834430.title: Lourdes, procession, III
834430.plot: People carry candles in a procession in Lourdes.

834433.title: Lourdes, leaving the Church of the Rosary
834433.plot: People come out the doors and down the steps of the Church of the Rosary in Lourdes.

834438.title: Lourdes, transporting the sick, I
834438.plot: Patients are conveyed in carriages toward the shrine in Lourdes.

834451.title: Battle of the flowers and float parade, I
834451.plot: Presents views of a parade in Montreux, including carts and donkeys covered with flowers, horsedrawn floats, bicycles, and people in native dress.

834458.title: Battle of the flowers and float parade, II
834458.plot: Presents views of a parade in Montreux, including carts and donkeys covered with flowers, horsedrawn floats, bicycles, and people in native dress.

834464.title: Battle of the flowers and float parade, III
834464.plot: Presents views of a parade in Montreux, including carts and donkeys covered with flowers, horsedrawn floats, bicycles, and people in native dress.

850712.title: 24ème chasseurs alpins : défilé au pas de gymnastique

850716.title: 24ème chasseurs alpins : exercices à la baïonnette

850720.title: 27ème chasseurs alpins : défilé du bataillon en masse

858595.title: Ambulance Call
858595.plot: "Stable door opens and ambulance dashes out into the street. Policeman holds back a furniture van till ambulance passes by."

865175.title: Cuirassé américain “San Francisco” en rade de Villefranche (panorama)

873464.title: Rue Royale: Église de la Madeleine
873464.plot: Street images with horse carriages passing by.

912491.title: Deyo
912491.plot: "A fascinating skirt dance by the well-known roof garden favorite."

912691.title: Baigneurs et plongeurs
912691.plot: It's a public pool, where some men stand by the pool, some dive into it, and other simply enjoy being being in the water.

912711.title: Garde républicaine à cheval
912711.plot: The troops ride their horses from the right edge of the frame to the left edge of the frame. It's among the simplest of actualities, since the framing is so square and central that it seems a simple statement of fact.

914758.title: Le Président Félix Faure aux courses
914758.plot: Clip showing president François Félix Faure and entourage walking the street.

914767.title: Passage de la Marne par les chevaux du 28e Dragons
914767.plot: This Pathe actuality of men and horses fording the Marne.

914772.title: Paysans à Paris
914772.plot: A comedy skit with drinking and animal tricks.

104471.title: The Haunted Castle
104471.plot: A man has an encounter with several spooky apparitions in a castle that is evidently owned by the Devil.

104473.title: The Surrender of Tournavos
104473.plot: Three military men, seen inside a fortification, are firing on an unseen enemy force. The call for reinforcements but ladders appear signalling the enemy is about to overrun this position.

104474.title: Between Calais and Dover
104474.plot: A rocky sea voyage as reenacted by Georges Méliès.

104476.title: The Bewitched Inn
104476.plot: A weary traveler stops at an inn along the way to get a good night's sleep, but his rest is interrupted by odd happenings when he gets to his room--beds vanishing and re-appearing, candles exploding, pants flying through the air and his shoes walking away by themselves.

104477.title: After the Ball
104477.plot: A woman arrives home after the ball. Her servant helps her undress and bathe.

982775.title: Burial of Gral. Sánchez Bregua
982775.plot: Arguably the first film to be produced in Galicia (Spain).

983060.title: San Jorge, Exit of the Mass
983060.plot: A bunch of people exit the Church of Saint George.

983063.title: Coal Factory
983063.plot: Short film where a Spanish coal factory is filmed.

983064.title: Plaza de Mina y Orzán
983064.plot: Spanish short film directed by French director Joseph Sellier.

983066.title: Waves at Orzán
983066.plot: Filming of the waves in Orzán Beach, Galicia (Spain).

983080.title: The Greetings
983080.plot: Second part of the film about people exiting the Church of the Pillar.

105165.title: Giant Coal Dumper
105165.plot: “Shows how a full carload of coal is loaded onto a vessel every thirty seconds at the great Erie Railroad Docks, Cleveland, Ohio. Great clouds of coal dust rise as each car is unloaded.”

105166.title: The X-Ray Fiend
105166.plot: A romantic couple are transformed into skeletons via X-Rays. The film combines two very recent innovations: Wilhelm Roentgen's discovery of X-rays in 1895, and Georges Méliès' accidental realisation of the special-effects potential of the jump-cut in 1896.

1006473.title: Paris: firefighters, I. Passage of the pumps
1006473.plot: The view represents a street in Paris along which pumps descend drawn by horses; the crowd follows en masse.

1036324.title: Arrival of a Two-Stage Train in France
1036324.plot: Old film of a two-stage train arriving in France, 1897.

1049676.title: Brighton Seagoing Electric Car
1049676.plot: Short film about the Brighton Seagoing Electric Car.

1059635.title: Jeux à la campagne
1059635.plot: Near a chalet in a cow pasture in the Jura, at Frohburg (Canton of Solothurn), Jenny Lavanchy-Clarke and her children Christine, Henri, and Bertha watch three lively pairs of boys doing an imitation of the lutte à la culotte (traditional Swiss wrestling). There is even a referee, stick in hand, and a judge noting the score.

1060179.title: Suisse: Exercices de tir par l'artillerie
1060179.plot: Cadet manoeuvres at the Aarau Children’s Festival (the Maienzug).

1060515.title: Saut de haies par des militaires à l'hippodrome de Schützenmatte à Bâle

1060577.title: Saut de haies et course à l'hippodrome de Schützenmatte à Bâle
1060577.plot: A military horse show in Basel.

1066213.title: Cortège d'enfants à Aarau
1066213.plot: A children’s procession that is part of the Maienzug, a festival solemnly marking the end of the school year in Aarau.

1066219.title: La fosse aux ours de Berne
1066219.plot: The bear is the emblem of Bern, and the pit that used to house several of the animals was the most common motif in representations of the city, as well as a central tourist attraction.

1066402.title: Marché à Berne
1066402.plot: A city view, rich in movement, shot at the corner of the Schauplatzgasse in Bern.

1082229.title: The Transformation of a Hat
1082229.plot: Félicien Trewey uses a basic prop to create comical hats and their accompanying caricatures.

119948.title: The Fisherman at the Stream
119948.plot: A boy is fishing in a stream when some others see an opportunity for mischief.

119949.title: Bathing in a Stream
119949.plot: A group of kids play in a stream.

119950.title: Serpentine Dance by Mme. Bob Walter
119950.plot: Mme. Bob Walter performs the serpentine dance.

119955.title: The Burglars
119955.plot: Cops chase a pair of burglars on the rooftops of the city.

124032.title: The Sign Writer
124032.plot: Man paints 'This house to let' and then the film is reversed.

144391.title: Snowball Fight
144391.plot: Wintertime in Lyon. About a dozen people, men and women, are having a snowball fight in the middle of a tree-lined street. The cyclist coming along the road becomes the target of opportunity. He falls off his bicycle. He's not hurt, but he rides back the way he came, as the fight continues.

145974.title: Bowery Waltz
145974.plot: A vaudeville routine: two denizens of the Bowery dance while under the influence. She's wearing a light dress with a full skirt. He wears a white sport coat and tie. Both have hats. On a small stage, she approaches him gingerly, leaning forward. He grabs her close, she leans into him, and he waltzes her around. (IMDb)

147397.title: Mr. Edison at Work in His Chemical Laboratory
147397.plot: “This film is remarkable in several respects. In the first place, it is full life-size. Secondly, it is the only accurate recent portrait of the great inventor. The scene is an actual one, showing Mr. Edison in working dress engaged in an interesting chemical experiment in his great Laboratory. There is sufficient movement to lead the spectator through the several processes of mixing, pouring, testing, etc. as if he were side by side with the principal. The lights and shadows are vivid, and the apparatus and other accessories complete a startling picture that will appeal to every beholder.” (Edison Catalog)

147610.title: The Corbett-Fitzsimmons Fight
147610.plot: This legendary fight was filmed on March 17, 1897, using 63mm film that produced an aspect ratio of about 1.75:1. Using three adjacent cameras, Enoch Rector recorded the entire fight, simultaneously creating the world's first known feature film, as the resulting footage lasted over 90 minutes in length. About a quarter of the film survives today.

152207.title: Seminary Girls
152207.plot: From Maguire & Baucus catalogue: A most amusing and life-like scene, in which a number of young ladies clad in their night robes, are seen engaged in a midnight frolic.

155858.title: Peeping Tom
155858.plot: A man peeping through a keyhole at an attractive young woman gets his comeuppance. This film, presumed lost, is often mistaken for Ferdinand Zecca's "What Is Seen Through a Keyhole" (1901).

155859.title: Pillow Fight
155859.plot: “A comic subject, clear, bright and characteristic. Shows four girls in their night dresses, engaged in an animated pillow fight. During the action the pillows become torn, and the feathers fly over their heads and about the room in great numbers, producing with the white dresses and the black background a novel effect. Sharp, full of action, and popular in character.” (Edison Catalog)

162857.title: Admiral Cigarette
162857.plot: A commercial. Four men sit in animated conversation in front of a billboard for Admiral Cigarettes. The billboard fills the entire background

163112.title: Arrest in Chinatown, San Francisco, Cal.
163112.plot: The title tells us where we are; the vignette is in two parts, spliced together. On a busy sidewalk, a police officer holds the left arm and a suited man holds the other of a Chinese wearing a loose white shirt and hat - marching the man up the slight incline past the camera.
